page.title: 03Green Lanes
page.content: In this area several Green Lanes have survived. These are ancient rights of way which unlike other country lanes, were never metalled and are now used as footpaths and bridleways. Yelnow Lane and Forty Foot Lane are two examples imporant both from a landscape and wildlife viewpoint. Their value to both lies in their natural character and relative seclusion compared to the verges of an ordinary road, which they would be if they had been surfaced. The Lanes are of ancient origin and are rich in variety of shrubs and trees and associated fauna. From a 30 yards section of hedge at Forty Foot Lane 11 different species of shrubs and trees were found. This confirms that this is an ancient boundary, as it can be assumed 100 years of age for each species found in a hedgerow.
